verses.verse: Hope deferred makes the heart sick, But (Prov. 13:19) when the desire comes, it is a tree of life.
He who (Num. 15:31; 2 Chr. 36:16; Is. 5:24) despises the word will be destroyed, But he who fears the commandment will be rewarded.
(Prov. 6:22; 10:11; 14:27) The law of the wise is a fountain of life, To turn one away from (2 Sam. 22:6) the snares of death.
Good understanding gains (Ps. 111:10; Prov. 3:4) favor, But the way of the unfaithful is hard.
(Prov. 12:23) Every prudent man acts with knowledge, But a fool lays open his folly.
A wicked messenger falls into trouble, But (Prov. 25:13) a faithful ambassador brings health.
Poverty and shame will come to him who disdains correction, But (Prov. 15:5, 31, 32) he who regards a rebuke will be honored.
A desire accomplished is sweet to the soul, But it is an abomination to fools to depart from evil.
He who walks with wise men will be wise, But the companion of fools will be destroyed.
(Ps. 32:10; Is. 47:11) Evil pursues sinners, But to the righteous, good shall be repaid.
A good man leaves an inheritance to his childrenâ€™s children, But (Job 27:16, 17; Prov. 28:8; (Eccl. 2:26)) the wealth of the sinner is stored up for the righteous.
(Prov. 12:11) Much food is in the fallow ground of the poor, And for lack of justice there is waste.
(Prov. 19:18) He who spares his rod hates his son, But he who loves him disciplines him promptly.
(Ps. 34:10; Prov. 10:3) The righteous eats to the satisfying of his soul, But the stomach of the wicked shall be in want.
The wise woman builds her house, But the foolish pulls it down with her hands.
He who walks in his uprightness fears the LORD, ((Rom. 2:4)) But he who is perverse in his ways despises Him.
In the mouth of a fool is a rod of pride, (Prov. 12:6) But the lips of the wise will preserve them.
Where no oxen are, the trough is clean; But much increase comes by the strength of an ox.
A (Rev. 1:5; 3:14) faithful witness does not lie, But a false witness will utter (Ex. 23:1; Deut. 19:16; Prov. 6:19; 12:17) lies.
A scoffer seeks wisdom and does not find it, But (Prov. 8:9; 17:24) knowledge is easy to him who understands.
Go from the presence of a foolish man, When you do not perceive in him the lips of (Prov. 23:9) knowledge.
The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way, But the folly of fools is deceit.
(Prov. 10:23) Fools mock at sin, But among the upright there is favor.
The heart knows its own bitterness, And a stranger does not share its joy.
(Job 8:15) The house of the wicked will be overthrown, But the tent of the upright will flourish.
(Prov. 16:25) There is a way that seems right to a man, But (Rom. 6:21) its end is the way of (Prov. 12:15) death.
Even in laughter the heart may sorrow, And (Prov. 5:4; Eccl. 2:1, 2) the end of mirth may be grief.
The backslider in heart will be (Prov. 1:31; 12:15) filled with his own ways, But a good man will be satisfied from (Prov. 13:2; 18:20) above.
The simple believes every word, But the prudent considers well his steps.
(Job 28:28; Ps. 34:14; Prov. 22:3) A wise man fears and departs from evil, But a fool rages and is self-confident.
A quick-tempered man acts foolishly, And a man of wicked intentions is hated.
The simple inherit folly, But the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
The evil will bow before the good, And the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
(Prov. 19:7) The poor man is hated even by his own neighbor, But the rich has many (Prov. 19:4) friends.
He who despises his neighbor sins; (Ps. 112:9; (Prov. 19:17)) But he who has mercy on the poor, happy is he.
